alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Freezing Fog Advisory issued January 09 at 8:12AM PST until January 09 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FREEZING FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility a quarter mile or less in freezing fog. * WHERE...Central Douglas County, Eastern Curry County and Josephine County and Jackson County including Roseburg, Cave Junction, Medford, Central Point, and portions of Grants Pass. Interstate 5 and Highway 199 is included in the Advisory. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility and potential frost on bridges. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * If possible, wait for temperatures to warm above freezing before traveling. * Slow down and give 3 times as much space as normal between vehicles. * Shaded areas may be more slippery than unshaded areas. * Use low beams. High beams reflect back fog making visibility worse for you and other drivers. * Fog makes objects appear farther away than they are. * Be ready for low visibility by keeping your headlights clean. * Don`t use cruise control. Most crashes occur because the driver is going too fast for weather conditions.

area.areaDesc: Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Jackson County
